definitions.definition: A legally or socially binding conceptual contract of entitlement to wealth, void of intrinsic value, payable for all debts and taxes, and regulated in supply.
A generally accepted means of exchange and measure of value.
definitions.example: Before colonial times cowry shells imported from Mauritius were used as money in Western Africa.

definitions.definition: A currency maintained by a state or other entity which can guarantee its value (such as a monetary union).
Hard cash in the form of banknotes and coins, as opposed to cheques/checks, credit cards, or credit more generally.
The total value of liquid assets available for an individual or other economic unit, such as cash and bank deposits.
Wealth; a person, family or class that possesses wealth
An item of value between two or more parties used for the exchange of goods or services.
A person who funds an operation.
